titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Brown Family Papers, 1825-1912, 1965 (Bulk 1850-1894)
titlestmt.subtitle: Brown Family Papers Ms1990-011

publicationstmt.date: Â©2009 By Virginia Tech. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-02-14 10:35:49-0500

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1990-011

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Brown Family Papers, 1825-1912, 1965
did.abstract: The collection consists of receipts, bills, Promissory notes, tax notes, letters, and other various papers created between 1825 and 1912 by members of the Brown, and other related families.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Brown Family Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Brown Family Papers, Ms1990-011, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Brown Family Papers were donated to Special Collections in 1990. Additional materials were donated in 1994.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Brown Family Papers commenced and was completed in May 1998.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: James Cartmill Brown was born in 1828. Brown was a farmer in Montgomery County, Virginia. About 1851, he married Ann Elizabeth Thomas (b. abt. 1831). They had at least six children: Mellie (Mollie?) (b. abt. 1854), John C. (b. abt. 1857), D. Howe (b. abt. 1859), Florence E. (b. abt. 1864), Robert L. (b. abt. 1867), and James M. (b. abt. 1872). Brown died in 1913.

Thomas Brown was probably James Cartmill Brown's brother, but it is unclear if this is Thomas W. or Thomas M. (both are mentioned in the collection). A number of items relate to Annie E. Barnett, but her connection to the family is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Brown Family Papers contain the papers of James Cartmill Brown (1828-1913), a landowner of a farm on the north fork of the Roanoke River in Montgomery County, Virginia. The materials consist of receipts, bills, Promissory notes, tax notes, letters, and other various papers created between 1825 and 1912, with the bulk of the collection from 1850 to 1894, by members of the Brown family, as they purchased services and goods from business people in their community. The collection includes receipts from the services of Dr. Harvey (Harvy) Black of Blacksburg, and genealogical material of the Brown lineage created in 1965.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged folders by year. Documents are filed based on the year of creation, rather than payment, court, or other dates.
